parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. While the post mentions the RMDSZ (Democratic Alliance of Hungarians in Romania), it does not refer to a specific candidate by name or surname.  The post focuses on the success of the Hungarian community in the elections, not on a particular individual.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is published on a public Facebook page ("Maszol.ro") and is a paid advertisement, indicating an intention to reach a wide audience, not just specific individuals.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post seems to be celebrating the perceived success of the Hungarian community in the elections, expressing pride and hope. It does not explicitly urge voters to vote for or against any specific candidate. The language used is celebratory and reflective, not persuasive or directive in terms of voting choices.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post can be interpreted as a form of citizen journalism, offering commentary and analysis on the election results from a specific community perspective. It presents an opinion, but doesn't directly advocate for a particular candidate or party.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. While it expresses an opinion, it's not a personal opinion in the sense of an individual expressing their feelings. It's a news outlet expressing an opinion on the outcome of the elections for a specific community.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>3707571656221444</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while related to the Romanian parliamentary elections and published by a news outlet, does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The post celebrates the perceived success of the Hungarian community in the elections, but it does not explicitly endorse or oppose any specific candidate or party.  It lacks the direct call to action or persuasive language characteristic of electoral propaganda. The post is more akin to commentary or analysis, falling under the realm of journalism or citizen journalism.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Maszol.ro</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
